arm_group.description: Western therapy(oral care, skin care and reducing temperature) Placebo for JET(Jinlianqingre Effervescent Tablets )
Jinlianqingre Effervescent Tablets plus western therapy

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Jinlianqingre Effervescent
      Tablets, a traditional Chinese medicine (TCM), in the treatment of Uncomplicated hand, foot,
      and mouth disease (HFMD).

clinical_study.brief_title: Chinese Medicinal Treatment on Mild Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease: Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study

detailed_description.textblock:
By adopting a multicenter, prospective, randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled, this
      study is aimed to evaluate the effectiveness, safety of a traditional Chinese medicine,
      Jinlianqingre Effervescent Tablets, for treatment Uncomplicated HFMD, and to provide
      scientific evidence for the construction of TCM methods in treating HFMD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of mild hand-foot-mouth disease patients according to
             Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease Treatment Guidelines 2010 issued by China's Ministry of
             Health;

          -  Within 48 hours of onset of fever and rash symptom.

          -  Age of 1-13 years.

          -  Documented body temperature 37.4 °C-39.0°C

          -  Patients or their guardians agree to participate in this study and signed the
             informed consent form.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Complicated with other serious diseases such as chronic hepatitis,chronic diarrhea
             disease,chronic diarrhea, congenital heart disease, acute or chronic nephritis and
             blood diseases.

          -  With history of allergies on traditional Chinese medicine.

          -  Attending other clinical studies on HFMD after diagnosed.

intervention.description: Physical cooling paste or warm bathing, vitamin B, vitamin C. On the basis of the attending physician's judgment, participants were allowed to use Ibuprofen suspension if their body temperature was greater than 38.5℃. Likewise, the need for antibiotics was determined by the attending physicians. The use of acetaminophen or antibiotics was recorded on the case record form
4g/tablet, One tablet each time (Taken after dissolved in 50ml boiled water, 3 times daily if body temperature≥38.5℃)
placebos prepared identical in color, taste and consistency to the JET (supplied by Zhongshenghaitian Pharmaceutical, Tianjin, China)

facility.name: Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu university of Traditional Chinese Medicine

overall_official.affiliation: China  Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences
The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

oversight_info.authority: China: State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine of the People's Republic of China

primary_outcome.description: Referring to the time of the armpit temperature of lower than 37.0 degrees Celsius, lasting for at least 24 hours, after the medicine is taken.
primary_outcome.measure: The time of body temperature going back to normal

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: China  Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

secondary_outcome.description: Referring to the number of days in the total-contact cast until the skin completely closed after the medicine is used.
secondary_outcome.measure: Healing time of skin or oral mucosa lesions symptom

secondary_outcome.description: Referring to Symptoms were hands, feet, oral mucosa lesions, buttock, crissum, back and four limbs. Each symptom was scored as 0 (none), 1 (mild), 2 (modest), or 3 (severe).
secondary_outcome.measure: Score of skin or oral mucosa lesions symptom during the study period time

secondary_outcome.description: Referring to pulmonary edema, cardiac damage, pneumonia, secondary infection, meningitis, encephalomyelitis et al.

The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
